[S191] The transaction was expected to close in early 2009, subject to approval by the U.S. [S192] Bankruptcy Court, but a competing bid was entered by the firm's management, who ultimately prevailed in a bankruptcy auction on December 3, 2008. [S193] Creditors of Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc. [S194] retain a 49% common equity interest in the firm, now known as Neuberger Berman Group LLC. [S195] In Europe, the Quantitative Asset Management Business has been acquired back by its employees on November 13, 2008 and has been renamed back to TOBAM. [S196] ### Financial fallout

Lehman's bankruptcy was the largest failure of an investment bank since Drexel Burnham Lambert collapsed in 1990 amid fraud allegations. [S197] Immediately following the bankruptcy filing, an already distressed financial market began a period of extreme volatility, during which the Dow experienced its largest one day point loss, largest intra-day range (more than 1,000 points) and largest daily point gain. [S198] What followed was what many have called the "perfect storm" of economic distress factors and eventually a $700bn bailout package (Troubled Asset Relief Program) prepared by Henry Paulson, Secretary of the Treasury, and approved by Congress. [S199] The Dow eventually closed at a new six-year low of 7,552.29 on November 20, followed by a further drop to 6626 by March of the next year. [S200] The fall of Lehman also had a strong effect on small private investors such as bond holders and holders of so-called minibonds. [S201] In Germany, structured products, often based on an index, were sold mostly to private investors, elderly, retired persons, students and families. [S202] Most of those now worthless derivatives were sold by the German arm of Citigroup, the German Citibank now owned by Crédit Mutuel.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


### Ongoing litigation

[S203] On March 11, 2010, Anton R. [S204] Valukas, a court-appointed examiner, published the results of its year-long investigation into the finances of Lehman Brothers. [S205] This report revealed that Lehman Brothers used an accounting procedure termed repo 105 to temporarily exchange $50 billion of assets into cash just before publishing its financial statements. [S206] The action could be seen to implicate both Ernst & Young, the bank's accountancy firm and Richard S. [S207] Fuld, Jr, the former CEO. [S208] This could potentially lead to Ernst & Young being found guilty of financial malpractice and Fuld facing time in prison. [S209] According to *The Wall Street Journal*, in March 2011, the SEC announced that they weren't confident that they could prove that Lehman Brothers violated US laws in its accounting practices. [S210] In October 2011, the administrators of Lehman Brothers Holding Inc. [S211] lost their appeal to overturn a court order forcing them to pay £148 million into their underfunded pensions plan. [S212] As of January 2016, Lehman paid more than $105 billion to its unsecured creditors. [S213] In addition, JPMorgan will pay $1.42 billion in cash to settle a lawsuit accusing JPMorgan of draining Lehman Brothers liquidity right before the crash. [S214] The settlement would permit another $1.496 billion to be paid to creditors and a separate $76 million deposit. [S215] The brokerage unit of Lehman Brothers completed its liquidation process on September 28, 2022, after paying out over $115 billion to its customers and creditors over the course of 14 years. [S216] As of December 2022, Lehman's British operations were being administrated by PricewaterhouseCoopers, which expected to complete the administration process no earlier than 2025.
